title: In Fresh Trouble For Anil Ambani, Probe Agency ED Writes To Multiple Banks
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has written to multiple banks seeking details on the loans sanctioned to Reliance Housing Finance, Reliance Communications and Reliance Commercial Finance, people familiar with the matter told NDTV Profit on Monday.

title: Dehradun Schools Shut Amid Predictions Of Heavy Rain, Orange Alert
content: In Uttarakhand, the India Meteorological Department  has issued an orange alert for three days in the districts of Dehradun, Nainital, Champawat, Bageshwar, Pauri Garhwal and Udham Singh Nagar.

title: "I'm Left With Nothing": Hemant Soren's Tribute To Father Shibu Soren
content: Shibu Soren - a former Union Minister, former Jharkhand Chief Minister and one of the founders of the Jharkhand Mukti Morcha died at 8:56 am today.

title: Rs 422 Crore Patna Flyover, Opened 2 Months Ago, Develops Cracks Due To Rain
content: A double-decker flyover in Patna, built with an aim to ease traffic congestion and improve connectivity in the capital, developed cracks after incessant rain.

title: 'Feared Being Deported': Family Of Man Found Dead At Kolkata House
content: A 63-year-old man was found hanging in his residence in Kolkata on Sunday morning, with his family claiming that he had been living in fear that he would be sent to Bangladesh if the National Register of Citizens (NRC) was implemented.

title: Maharashtra Teen Jumps To Death From Hill As Mother Refuses To Buy Phone
content: The boy, identified as Atharva Gopal Tayde, was asking his mother to buy him a phone for days. However, she refused every time.

title: PM Modi Defiant As Trump Steps Up Pressure On India's Russian Oil Purchases
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi struck a defiant tone in the face of US President Donald Trump's tariff threats, urging the nation to buy local goods as his administration signaled it would continue buying Russian oil.

title: 'Thirst Is Stealing My Energy': Gaza Struggles With Severe Water Shortage
content: Atop air strikes, displacement and hunger, an unprecedented water crisis is unfolding across Gaza, heaping further misery on the Palestinian territory's residents.

title: Trump Confirms Special Envoy Steve Witkoff's Russia Visit Ahead Of Sanctions Deadline
content: President Donald Trump confirmed Sunday his special envoy Steve Witkoff will visit Russia in the coming week, ahead of a looming US sanctions deadline and escalating tensions with Moscow.

title: With AQI At 74, Delhi Air Quality At Its Best In A Decade: Delhi Chief Minister
content: Citing the latest Air Quality Index of 74, CM Rekha Gupta highlighted the government's ongoing efforts to reduce the city's pollution, and claimed that for the first time in a decade, the index has come down to such a satisfactory level.

title: India Fact Checks Reports On Centre's Review Of US Goods Exempted From Tariffs
content: Amid the ongoing tariff row with the United States, India has debunked fake news reports claiming that the Narendra Modi government was reviewing a list of US-made products exempted from import duties.

title: Panic At Guwahati PVR As Ceiling Collapses During Movie Screening, 3 Injured
content: Panic and chaos erupted at a PVR cinema hall in Guwahati after a portion of the false ceiling collapsed during a film screening, injuring at least three individuals, including children.

title: 3,200 Boeing Workers Who Build Fighter Jets To Go On Strike, First Since 1996
content: Boeing Co. is bracing for the first strike in nearly three decades at its St. Louis-area defense factories after union members rejected the company's modified contract offer.

title: Tailor Who Kidnapped, Murdered 8-Year-Old Arrested After 26 Years In Delhi
content: A man convicted of kidnapping and murdering an eight-year-old boy in 1993 has been arrested by the Crime Branch of the Delhi Police after evading law for over 26 years.

title: Pahalgam Attack Victim's Father Writes To PM Modi, Demands Compensation, Martyr Status
content: Sanjay Dwivedi, father of Pahalgam terror attack victim Shubham Dwivedi, has written two letters to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and demanded compensation for the families of the April 22 deadly attack victims and a grant of "martyr status".

title: "We're Going To Pay Down Debt": Donald Trump On Tariffs
content: Donald Trump, on August 1, signed a new executive order slapping higher tariffs on dozens of countries - hours before the trade deal deadline.

title: Son Used Fake Papers To Recover Gangster Mukhtar Ansari's Assets, Arrested
content: Umar Ansari, son of late gangster-turned-politician Mukhtar Ansari, was arrested on Sunday for allegedly submitting forged documents in court in a bid to recover his father's seized properties.

title: Netanyahu Urges Red Cross To Aid Hostages Amid Videos Of Emaciated Captives
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu requested the help of the International Committee of the Red Cross on Sunday to aid hostages in Gaza, as outrage built at videos showing two of them emaciated.

title: Border Force Punjab Foils Narco-Smuggling Attempts, Seizes 1.73 kg Heroin
content: Border Security Force (BSF) troops foiled multiple cross-border smuggling attempts along the Punjab border, apprehending two narco-smugglers in Tarn Taran and recovering several drones and heroin consignments in separate incidents.

title: How Bijan Robinson and Christian McCaffrey are forming a competitive bond
content: Along with Luke McCaffrey, the players shared tips about performance and recovery during offseason workouts.

title: NFLPA elects White as interim executive director
content: The NFL Players Association on Sunday night elected David White as its interim executive director, 17 days after the resignation of Lloyd Howell Jr.

title: Young wins elusive 1st PGA Tour title at Wyndham
content: Cameron Young finally got his first PGA Tour victory Sunday after seven runner-up finishes, coasting to a 2-under 68 to win the Wyndham Championship.

title: Lyles staredown, Bednarek shove cap tense 200m
content: The U.S. track championships turned physical Sunday, with Noah Lyles and Kenny Bednarek getting involved in a shoving and shouting match as they crossed the finish line of a hotly contested 200-meter final.

title: Miami says Messi injury 'minor,' no return date set
content: Inter Miami CF captain Lionel Messi suffered a "minor" muscle injury in his right leg Saturday night in the Leagues Cup match against Necaxa at Chase Stadium.

title: Khabib hopes McGregor changes 'how he is living'
content: Retired mixed martial arts legend Khabib Nurmagomedov said he hopes former rival Conor McGregor changes how he is living or "it will be punishment all his life."

title: Fins make Sieler their highest-paid defensive player
content: The Dolphins and defensive tackle Zach Sieler agreed to a three-year extension worth up to $67.75 million, making him the team's highest-paid defensive player.

title: Rodriguez makes history with another 20-20 year
content: Julio Rodriguez homered to become the first player in major league history with 20 or more home runs and 20 or more stolen bases in each of his first four seasons.

title: Amorim backs Fernandes' criticism of 'lazy' United
content: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim has backed Bruno Fernandes' criticism of the performance in their 2-2 draw with Everton by saying he's happy for his players to call it out if they see a drop in standards.

title: üèà Making sense of Terry McLaurin's trade request
content: The Commanders' star wide receiver wants a new extension -- or a new team.  Can they justify paying him? And what could they get if they dealt him?

title: WNBA trade grades: Wings cut ties with Carrington, look to future
content: The Lynx added DiJonai Carrington as WNBA contenders upgrade their rosters before the Aug. 7 trade deadline.

title: Why Luka Doncic left guaranteed money on the table to chase an even bigger future payday
content: The Luka Era in L.A. has officially begun. Here's what you need to know about Doncic's three-year, $165 million deal.

title: Do Not Draft list: McCaffrey, Andrews among players being overvalued

content: From top 10 picks to Year 1 breakouts, who are the most interesting players to watch in their sophomore season?

title: Arsenal's preseason Asia tour in review

content: From Florida to North Carolina, the "SportsCenter" 50 state tour continues. We're back for our penultimate quiz of the summer.

title: Solak's annual ranking of all 32 NFL coaching staffs: A new No. 1 and No. 32 ahead of the season

title: 'Some coaches have no idea': The uncertainties of recruiting in the new rev-share era

title: JMM founder and former Jharkhand CM Shibu Soren dies at 81 after prolonged illness
content: Shibu Soren was admitted to the Sri Ganga Ram Hospital in the national capital and was in life support following an illness

title: Eight militants arrested in Manipur

content: The death had then raised serious questions about existence of internal complaint committees mandated under Internal Committee mandated under the Sexual Harassment of Women at Workplace (Prevention, Prohibition and Redressal) Act, 2013

content: The minor's body reached the Biju Patnaik International Airport here before being taken to her native place at Balanga in Puri district, amid tight security arrangements

content: The Yellow and Orange Lines together will benefit nearly 25 lakh people in Bengaluru South, according to Bangalore South MP Tejasvi Surya

content: Thanking the Union Minister for sanctioning new road projects costing ‚Çπ27,000 crore, the Chief Minister promises to ensure land acquisition issues do not hamper their execution  ¬†

title: BJP committed to uplift of denotified tribes, says Andhra party president Madhav
content: Stating that these marginalised communities have been subjected to neglect for long, the BJP leader highlights the measures taken by the NDA government at the Centre to restore their identity and dignity

title: Quartz mining brings political rivalry to the fore in Nellore district
content: While TDP MP Vemireddy Prabhakar Reddy terms the allegations as baseless, YSRCP leader Anil Kumar sees attempt to corner him politically

title: Family alleges NRC fear behind elderly man‚Äôs death in Kolkata
content: The deceased worked as a non-teaching staff member at a private school in south Kolkata. He had arrived in Kolkata in 1972 from Nawabganj in Dhaka

content: The criticism of India by Stephen Miller, deputy chief of staff at the White House, was one of the strongest yet by the Trump administration

title: Another slip up by India in the trade pact with the U.K.
content: There is a dilution of India‚Äôs backing of the more effective compulsory licensing to address the high prices of patented medicines

title: On the track towards belonging
content: More than a feat of engineering, completion of the line is a reaffirmation of a social contract between the people of Kashmir and the Indian Union

title: While in power AIADMK surrendered T.N.‚Äôs autonomy by backing Centre‚Äôs policies: Stalin
content: Mr. Stalin alleges that the BJP-led government at the Centre allocated meagre funding to Tamil, the first language in India to be recognised as a Classical Language, while allocating several crores of rupees for Sanskrit

title: Delete caste column from appraisal forms: T.N. Police Commission
content: The panel, headed by former Judge of the Madras High Court Justice C.T. Selvam and other senior serving and former bureaucrats, says there is no need for the superior officer appraising the professional work to know the caste of the police personnel

title: Using ‚ÄòBangladeshi for Bangla‚Äô an insult to Bengali culture: Trinamool
content: The Trinamool Congress has been calling for Bengali Asmita over the targeting of migrant workers in BJP ruled states

title: Despite nod from officials, motorable road is still on paper for tribespeople in Marayur
content: Karimutty tribal settlement is just 350 m away from the Munnar-Udumalpet National Highway. There is only a dirt road connecting the NH to the settlement, despite multiple petitions from the tribespeople

title: Philippines President Marcos Jr. to visit India as two sides deepen maritime cooperation
content: President Marcos Jr. will hold delegation-level talks with Prime Minister Modi with the two sides signing multiple agreements and MoUs¬†

content: On-duty medical staff targeted by patient‚Äôs attendants; protest over repeated attacks and lack of accountability

content: Press Club says action against reporter, portal for reposting victim‚Äôs account undermines press freedom

title: 58,000 personnel to be inducted in CISF over next five years, as Centre expects new industrial hubs in Maoist-affected States¬†
content: President sanctions enhancement in CISF authorised ceiling strength, from 2 lakh to 2.2 lakh; present strength is 1.62 lakh; CISF official says about 14,000 to be recruited per year over next five years

title: Thousands march in silent rally in Kolhapur, demanding return of elephant Mahadevi by NGO Vantara
content: The Bombay High Court on July 16 had allowed the relocation of the elephant to Vantara‚Äôs facility in Gujarat, noting that the elephant had been kept in solitary confinement and was reportedly in poor health

title: Opposition rejects Odisha Police claim in minor girl‚Äôs death in Puri
content: State unit of Congress warns of a gherao of the office of the Director General of Police if no action was taken within seven days

title: Comprehensive policy for Malayalam film industry within 2-3 months: Saji Cherian
content: Two-day Kerala Film Policy Conclave concludes. Minister says government has taken serious note of the issues raised by the junior artistes about their abject working conditions

title: Residents of Bengaluru‚Äôs Balagere protest over lack of basic civic infrastructure
content: Despite several complaints to the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike, there had been no action to rectify the situation

title: Forensic technique used for first time in Karnataka to identify Prajwal Revanna in video evidence
content: The Special Court for MP/MLAs has appreciated the probe carried out by the SIT for ‚Äútheir limpid examination in adopting and utilising the modern technology of scientific examination‚Äù, terming it a ‚Äúwelcome step‚Äù

title: Adoor Gopalakrishnan courts controversy at Kerala Film Policy Conclave, Minister counters him
content: He calls for providing training to SC/ST and women filmmakers whose movies are funded by the government and to reduce the amount to ‚Çπ50 lakh from the present ‚Çπ1.5 crore

title: CPI(M) and Congress accuse BJP of claiming credit for the nuns‚Äô release to score political brownie points
content: Schisms seemed to develop in the Church leadership over the question of whether the BJP national leadership had genuinely come to the aid of the nuns, as the party has claimed.

title: NDA seeks legal action against Tejashwi Yadav for allegedly holding two Voter ID cards
content: BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said the EPIC number cited by the RJD leader at a press conference was different from the one referred to by the ECI to refute his claim

title: Joshi says Rahul‚Äôs electoral malpractice charge is baseless
content: He should approach Election Commission of India if he has any evidence, according to the Union Minister

title: Tiruchi Corporation awaiting funds for Cauvery riverfront project
content: The civic body has identified a 1.5-km stretch between the Tiruchi-Chennai national highway bridge and railway track on Odathurai Road, and a 750-metre stretch between Amma Mandapam and Geethapuram in Srirangam for the project

title: SIR brings the INDIA bloc together for first physical meeting since June 2024
content: LoP Rahul Gandhi to host a dinner meeting for INDIA bloc leaders at his Delhi residence on August 7, followed by a joint protest march to the Election Commission headquarters the following day

title: A.P. government puts curbs on entry into school premises
content: The official directive by School Education Department has not gone down well with student unions, who have demanded immediate withdrawal of the decision

title: KTR urges party cadre to ensure victory in Jubilee Hills bypoll
content: Rama Rao alleged that top Congress leaders, including Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, misled the people of Telangana with fake guarantees during the elections

title: Row over Urology department HoD‚Äôs Facebook post: expert panel recommends measures for hassle-free supply of equipment
content: Although his intention was good, Dr. Haris Chirackal has violated the code of conduct for government employees, Committee observes

title: Chief Minister Naidu hails success of ‚ÄòShe Leads Andhra‚Äô pilot project in Kuppam
content: The Chief Minister announces an action plan to expand the project across the State, it is expected to cover over one lakh women across A.P. during a three-year action plan, covering 50 lakh households, says KADA Project Director

title: Amala Medical College launches AI system for drug safety
content: Partnership with DoctorAssist.AI introduces ‚ÄòSafeRx‚Äô to enhance antibiotic stewardship and clinical decision-making.

title: Six Odisha workers killed in rock collapse at granite quarry in A.P.‚Äôs Bapatla district
content: Three other injured are undergoing treatment and are said to be out of danger; Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu expresses grief over the tragedy, orders probe

title: Experts to discuss Tamil Nadu‚Äôs¬†urban growth, real estate transformation at The Hindu summit
content: At the August 5 event, there will be focus on¬†sustainable, inclusive, and forward-looking real estate¬†strategies with respect to the State‚Äôs¬†vision of becoming a trillion-dollar economy¬†

title: Air India cancels Singapore-Chennai flight due to technical issue
content: "Arrangements are being made to fly the passengers to Chennai at the earliest. Hotel accommodation is being provided, and full refunds on cancellation, or complimentary rescheduling is also being offered to passengers based on their preference," Air India said.

title: HC stays conviction of vax scientist for wife's suicide; cites 'national interest'
content: The Uttarakhand High Court has suspended the conviction of vaccine scientist Dr. Akash Yadav, who was found guilty of abetment to suicide in connection with his wife's death in 2015. The court acknowledged Yadav's crucial role in public health and national immunization efforts, stating that his conviction hindered his ability to contribute to vaccine programs.

title: India financing Russia's war, says Trump's aide
content: A senior Trump administration official, Stephen Miller, has criticised India for its continued purchase of Russian oil, asserting it fuels the Russia-Ukraine war. Miller highlighted the surprising scale of India's oil imports from Russia, nearly matching China's. This rebuke follows the imposition of tariffs on Indian goods and warnings of further penalties if oil purchases continue without a peace agreement.

title: Exclusive | 'Very surprising': Indian World Junior Champ's Grand Swiss entry has a wild backstory
content: In a surprise twist, India‚Äôs 2025 World Junior Champion Pranav Venkatesh has earned a wildcard entry to the prestigious 2025 FIDE Grand Swiss after defeating Kazakhstan‚Äôs GM Kazybek Nogerbek 1.5‚Äì0.5 in an unpublicised 'Asian Wildcard Match' in Al Ain, UAE. Pranav, who narrowly missed qualifying by rating, now joins an elite field chasing a spot in the 2026 Candidates.

title: 'Mistreated, missed my flight': Army officer files FIR against SpiceJet
content: An Army officer is under investigation after allegedly assaulting SpiceJet employees at Srinagar airport for enforcing baggage rules. The incident, which included serious injuries to staff, led to a police FIR and a viral video.

title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai to employees: ‚ÄòI think we have to....'
content: Google's CEO Sundar Pichai and executives like Brian Saluzzo are urging employees to accelerate the integration of AI into their workflows, aiming for increased productivity and efficiency. This push includes internal AI tools like Cider and training programs developed with DeepMind, such as "Building with Gemini," to enhance software engineers' capabilities.

title: IND vs ENG Test: Oval thriller goes to the wire! India hang by a thread
content: England's Harry Brook and Joe Root mounted a fierce counterattack, scoring centuries and turning the Oval into a battleground. India's Mohammed Siraj and Prasidh Krishna fought back, claiming crucial wickets to keep India in contention. With the series hanging in the balance, India needs four wickets on the final day to secure a 2-2 draw.

title: ‚ÄòDidn‚Äôt want him to meet wife, kids‚Äô: Woman stabs live-in partner to death in Gurgaon
content: In Gurgaon, Yashmeet Kaur was arrested for allegedly murdering her live-in partner, Harish. Police investigation revealed Harish was married with children. The incident occurred after a dispute. Harish wanted to return to his family. Kaur disapproved of his visits home. This led to a fatal argument. Police recovered a knife and T-shirt from the crime scene in DLF Phase 3.

title: IND vs ENG: R Ashwin slams Gill and Gambhir - 'In today's day and age...'
content: R Ashwin has criticized Shubman Gill's captaincy and Gautam Gambhir's coaching during the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series, citing a "lack of game awareness." Ashwin pointed out missed opportunities to utilize spinners effectively, particularly Washington Sundar, which he believes contributed to England's advantage.

title: Apple CEO Tim Cook: Majority of new iPhones sold in US are 'made' in India; while Vietnam is for ...
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook stated that most iPhones sold in the US during the last quarter were made in India, despite Donald Trump's criticism of this manufacturing shift. India has become the main hub for iPhone production for the US market, while China focuses on non-US regions. Apple is experiencing record revenue growth in India, driven by strong iPhone sales.

title: 'India treats players like superstars, while USA sabotages theirs': Niemann
content: Hans Niemann sparked controversy by contrasting India's robust support system for chess players with the alleged shortcomings of the American chess federation. This followed Divya Deshmukh's historic FIDE Women‚Äôs World Cup win, celebrated with significant government recognition and financial rewards in India. Niemann suggests the diverging approaches will have clear consequences for chess talent development in the coming years.

title: Man falls off moving train, loses leg in 'phatka gang' phone snatching
content: A 22-year-old farmer, Gaurav Nikam, suffered a partial leg amputation after a 'Phatka gang' attack near Kalyan while traveling on the Tapovan Express. A minor struck Nikam, causing him to fall from the train, and then robbed him of his phone and cash. Kalyan GRP apprehended the 16-year-old accused from Irani Pada, a known crime hotspot.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Test cricket needed a series like this' - Ex-England captain
content: Nasser Hussain praises the feisty Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series, highlighting memorable moments and the competitive spirit between the teams. He appreciates the series' watchability and impact on Test cricket. However, Hussain criticizes the pitches for being too batting-friendly and the inconsistent scheduling with odd gaps between matches, suggesting a more balanced approach.

title: Mark Zuckerberg meets 24-yr-old AI researcher who rejected Meta's $125 million job offer, and then ...
content: Meta's aggressive pursuit of AI dominance led them to recruit 24-year-old Matt Deitke, initially offering $125 million, which he declined. Zuckerberg's personal intervention resulted in a revised $250 million package, including potential $100 million in the first year. Deitke, known for his work on Molmo and founding Vercept, is a highly sought-after AI talent.

title: Musk‚Äôs Neuralink: How it helps paralysed patients and aims to merge humans with AI
content: Elon Musk's Neuralink is making waves with its brain-computer interface. The 'Link' implant allows paralysed patients to control devices with their minds. Noland Arbaugh and Audrey Crews are among the early recipients. They are regaining digital independence. Neuralink envisions future applications like memory enhancement and brain-to-brain communication. The technology faces ethical and safety challenges.

title: ‚ÄòPosted sad videos‚Äô: Woman maintained 'devoted' image of after getting husband killed
content: Soniya, a 34-year-old woman, is accused of orchestrating her husband's murder, masking her involvement with social media posts portraying her as a grieving widow. Police investigations revealed her affair with Rohit, whom she allegedly planned to marry after eliminating her husband, Pritam Prakash.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 24,600; Sensex up over 170 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Monday. While Nifty50 went above 24,600, BSE Sensex was up over 150 points.

title: Brooke Hogan‚Äôs husband: Hulk Hogan showed no interest in meeting grandkids
content: Hulk Hogan's relationship with his daughter Brooke was strained before his death, with her husband, Steven Oleksy, revealing Hogan showed no interest in meeting his newborn twins, despite Brooke's efforts to reconnect. The couple had moved to Florida to support Hogan, but he remained distant, leaving Brooke heartbroken by unanswered attempts to reconcile.

title: Taylor Swift‚Äôs Kelce jacket inspires Kristin Juszczyk‚Äôs new NFL line
content: Kristin Juszczyk, the designer, is launching a new NFL collection. This follows Taylor Swift's viral moment in a custom jacket. The collection celebrates fan culture and team loyalty. It features Chiefs-themed items like corsets and tees. Juszczyk acknowledges the support from Chiefs Kingdom. She credits Swift and Brittany Mahomes for boosting her career.

title: Dak Prescott builds new mansion, reveals why he razed the last one
content: Dallas Cowboys quarterback Dak Prescott is rebuilding his Texas mansion in Prosper, aiming for a more contemporary and intimate design. Construction began after he demolished his previous multi-million-dollar estate in October 2024. The new structure, featuring clean lines and compartmentalized segments, appears to be a luxurious, multi-story residence.

title: 'Get deal that stops killing of people': Trump to Russia; again takes India-Pak credit
content: Donald Trump suggested Russia could avoid Ukraine war sanctions by reaching a deal to end the conflict, lamenting the high number of casualties on both sides. He also reiterated his claim of brokering peace between India and Pakistan, a statement previously denied by Indian officials.

title: Mamata Banerjee slams Delhi Police for ‚Äòhelp translate Bangladeshi‚Äô note
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has strongly criticized Delhi Police for a notice referring to Bengali as "Bangladeshi language" while seeking translation assistance for a case involving suspected illegal immigrants. Banerjee deemed the notice insulting and unconstitutional, urging protests against the perceived humiliation of Bengali speakers.

title: Paid killers with gold jewellery: Bizman found dead in Assam's Dibrugarh
content: In a shocking turn of events, a businessman in Dibrugarh was allegedly murdered in a conspiracy hatched by his wife and teenage daughter. The duo, along with two accomplices, have been arrested after inconsistencies in their statements and forensic evidence revealed their involvement.

title: Gabrielle Union on menopause: 'It makes it hard' ‚Äî motherhood now more emotional, exhausting
content: Hollywood actress Gabrielle Union discussed her experience with menopause and motherhood. She spoke about the challenges she faced, including hot flashes and memory loss. Union also mentioned the impact of an autoimmune issue. She and Dwyane Wade welcomed their daughter, Kaavia, via surrogacy in 2018. Union had previously experienced miscarriages.

title: MNS workers vandalise bar in Panvel hours after Raj Thackeray‚Äôs speech; 15 persons booked
content: Following a fiery speech by MNS president Raj Thackeray condemning dance bars in Raigad, MNS workers allegedly vandalized Night Riders The Bar in Panvel. The incident, captured in a viral video, shows individuals destroying furniture and liquor bottles.

title: IND vs ENG: Ahead of Day 5, Gavaskar says - 'Unless India level the series ...'
content: England are on the verge of securing a series victory against India in the fifth and final Test at The Oval, needing just 35 runs with four wickets remaining. Joe Root and Harry Brook's formidable partnership has put England in a commanding position. Sunil Gavaskar emphasises that only a win for India can level the series and acknowledge their superiority.

title: 5th Test: 'Injection liya kya tum?', Gill asks Akash Deep; watch
content: During the tense fourth day of the fifth Test, India's captain Shubman Gill was overheard on the stump mic urging the injured Akash Deep to return to bowling. This occurred as England's Joe Root and Harry Brook formed a formidable partnership, pushing England closer to victory. England ended the day at 339/6, needing only 35 more runs to win.

title: Tom Brady marks 48th birthday with sweet family photo with sister Julie
content: Tom Brady celebrated his 48th birthday surrounded by family, including his children and sister Julie. The NFL legend's summer included a family trip to Japan, attending a Venice wedding, and the debut of his Prime Video series about Birmingham City FC. Despite retirement, Brady remains active in sports business and enjoys family moments.

title: Canada wildfire: Thick smoke chokes Midwest, Northeast US; air alerts widen
content: Despite increased tariffs imposed by President Trump on Canadian goods, Canadian Trade Minister Dominic LeBlanc affirmed ongoing negotiations with the US, emphasizing the potential for mutually beneficial economic cooperation. LeBlanc cited constructive talks with US officials and highlighted Canada's commitment to addressing American trade concerns, while Prime Minister Carney expressed disappointment and refuted suggestions of closer US integration.

title: Ohio couple welcomes baby; born from embryo frozen 31 years ago
content: An Ohio couple, Lindsey and Tim Pierce, celebrated the birth of their son from an embryo frozen for over 30 years, potentially a record. They opted for embryo adoption after struggling with infertility. The embryo was donated by Linda Archerd, who had frozen it in 1994 during her IVF treatment.

title: IND vs ENG: Injury rules Bumrah out of 5th Test, not workload - all you need to know
content: Jasprit Bumrah missed the fifth Test against England because of a knee injury. This decision was precautionary. Bumrah had a good series, taking 14 wickets. His absence raised concerns given his injury history. His participation in the Asia Cup and West Indies series is uncertain. England moved closer to a series win, with Joe Root and Harry Brook scoring centuries.

title: Steve Bannon: ‚ÄòNo foreign students should be here‚Äô ‚Äî Impact on H-1B and US future
content: A sweeping call by Steve Bannon to expel foreign students from the US has sparked new anxieties among international scholars and skilled visa holders. As Trump-era allies revive anti-immigration rhetoric, Bannon‚Äôs remarks hint at a broader ideological shift that could jeopardize student visas, H-1B pathways, and the future of global talent in America.

title: Mukhtar Ansari‚Äôs son Umar arrested; accused of claiming father's seized property
content: Umar Ansari, son of Mukhtar Ansari, was arrested in Lucknow on Sunday night. Ghazipur police made the arrest. He is accused of trying to reclaim property seized under the Gangsters Act. Officials say he submitted forged documents with fake signatures of his mother, Afsa Ansari. This is the sixth case against Umar.

title: Teen girl dies after 'swimming on a full stomach', here's what happened
content: A tragic incident occurred in Cleethorpes where Lucy Reid, 15, lost her life. She went swimming in the River Humber soon after consuming pizza and chips. The strong tide swept her away from the shore. After struggling in the water, she vomited and inhaled the contents. Rescue efforts were made, but she was declared dead at the hospital. Read below!

title: Trump schedules first ‚ÄòGolden Dome‚Äô test ahead of 2028 election-Here's what report said
content: The Trump administration plans a major test of the 'Golden Dome' space-based missile defense system just before the 2028 elections. This ambitious project, aiming to create a protective shield for the U.S., faces technical and economic challenges. Space Force Gen. Michael Guetlein is overseeing the development, with initial tests focusing on demonstrating viability for further funding.

title: 'Saiyaara' box office day17: Film misses Rs 300 cr mark by a hair, still shines with Rs 299.75 cr
content: Ahaan Panday and Aneed Padda‚Äôs ‚ÄòSaiyaara‚Äô nearly reached Rs. 300 crore in its third weekend, grossing Rs. 299.75 crore despite competition from new releases like ‚ÄòSon of Sardaar 2‚Äô and ‚ÄòDhadak 2‚Äô. ‚ÄòSaiyaara‚Äô had a strong opening week, earning Rs 172.75 crore, and continued its success into the second week with Rs 107.75 crore.

title: EV push: Government to exempt electric vehicles from 15-year phaseout; aims to boost sales, adoption
content: To boost electric vehicle adoption, the government is likely to exempt EVs from the 15-year 'End of Life' regulation. The power ministry will expedite extending CAFE norms to urban freight vehicles, trucks, and buses. These steps aim to address the slow EV penetration rate and encourage faster adoption through mandates, disincentives, and improved charging infrastructure.

title: Hailee Steinfeld's latest workout photos break the internet
content: While Josh Allen focuses on football, Hailee Steinfeld prioritizes her well-being through fitness and mindfulness. She emphasizes the importance of workouts for mental clarity and emotional resilience, supported by her father, Pete Steinfeld, a personal trainer. Hailee embraces balance, letting go of past body image struggles and finding joy in her wellness journey, setting an example of inner strength.

title: ‚ÄòHe wants her to feel safe‚Äô: Travis Kelce prioritizing Taylor Swift‚Äôs privacy
content: Travis Kelce recently shared rare photos with Taylor Swift on social media, a move reportedly discussed with the pop star beforehand. Sources reveal Kelce prioritized Swift's comfort and privacy, ensuring she approved of the images before posting. While Kelce gears up for the NFL season and Swift remains out of the public eye, their relationship nears the two-year mark.

title: Night 2 results: Lesnar returns, Rhodes wins undisputed WWE championship
content: SummerSlam Night 2 featured the latest installment of the  John Cena retirement tour , as he put his Undisputed WWE Championship up for grabs against former titleholder Cody Rhodes at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, New Jersey. After a marathon "street fight" match, Rhodes won his title back from the legend Cena. After the match, Brock Lesnar made his return to the WWE, delivering an F-5 to a stunned Cena. That was the final of many title matches on Night 2. Naomi retained her title in the opening match of the card, and Becky Lynch retained hers with a win over Lyra Valkyria. Later, Solo Sikoa outlasted Jacob Fatu in a steel cage match to retain the United States Championship, and Dominik Mysterio held on to the men's Intercontinental Championship with a win over AJ Styles. ESPN reporter Greg Wyshynski highlights the biggest moments and more from SummerSlam Night 2.

title: How did the Cowboys and Parsons get here? Plus league reaction and what‚Äôs next
